com.soa.transport.http.deploy

Interface FilterRegistration

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DelegatingFilterRegistration, SimpleFilterRegistration

    public interface FilterRegistration
    Instances of this interface can be published as OSGi services, which will result in any capable HTTP server registering the filter and activating it. This is an SOA-specific registration interface, and will work with the SOA HTTP service either in a standalone deployment or inside a J2EE container.

    • Method Detail

      • getDispatch

        int getDispatch()
        Get the dispatch flags that indicate at what point the filter should be inviked
        Returns:
        An or'ed combination of the enumerated dispatch flags, DISPATCH_REQUEST, DISPATCH_FORWARD, DISPATCH_INCLUDE, DISPATCH_ERROR or the convenience definitions DISPATCH_DEFAULT or DISPATCH_ALL.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Get the name of this Filter.
        Returns:
        The filter name that will be used by the J2EE container

      • getFilter

        javax.servlet.Filter getFilter()
        Get the filter
        Returns:
        The actual Filter instance that will be deployed. The Filter's init(FilterConfig) method will be invoked when the filter is initialized within the J2EE container.

      • getInitParameters

        java.util.Map getInitParameters()
        Get the filter's init params
        Returns:
        The init params for the filter. These will be passed to the Filter's init method when the filter is initialized in the container.

      • getContext

        java.lang.String getContext()
        Get the root context that this filter belongs to. This allows the framework to associate the filter with a web application in scenarios where there may be multiple web applications deployed.
        Returns:
        The string root context path for the web application that this filter belongs to. This may be null, in which case it is assumed to be "/".

      • getPathSpec

        java.lang.String getPathSpec()
        Get the path name mapping for the filter
        Returns:
        A path name spec for this filter. This may be null, in which case the assigned servlet mapping will be used. If both are null, this filter will be applied to all requests for the context.

      • getServlet

        java.lang.String getServlet()
        Get the servlet mapping for the filter
        Returns:
        A servlet name for this filter. The filter will be applied to all requests directed to the named servlet, if it exists. If this is null and the path spec is null, the filter will be applied to all requests for the context.
